H0.text: Excretory and digestive systems are the two systems most directly involved in oxygen‑rich blood returning from the lungs to the heart.

H1.text: Circulatory and excretory are the two systems most directly involved in the return of oxygen‑rich blood from the lungs to the heart.

H2.text: Digestive and respiratory systems are the two systems most directly involved in the process of oxygen‑rich blood returning from the lungs to the heart.

H3.text: The respiratory and circulatory systems are the two systems most directly involved in the process of oxygen‑rich blood returning from the lungs to the heart.

A4.text: The primary purpose of the respiratory system is the equalizing of the partial pressures of the respiratory gases in the alveolar air with those in the pulmonary capillary blood.

A5.text: The blood capillaries leaving the exchanger near the entrance of airflow take up more O2 than do the capillaries leaving near the exit end of the parabronchi.
